Package com.accenture.fers.utils

Class Validador

java.lang.Object
com.accenture.fers.utils.Validador
public class Validador
extends java.lang.Object
Class that holds all the diferents validation method to be used in the Project
Version:
v1.1 First version of the validation method that are tested under the rest of the classes
Author:
f.vasquez.tort

  • Method Details

    • checkEmail

      public static boolean checkEmail​(java.lang.String email, int min, int max)
      Method that is used to check is and email entered by the user is valid or not. It's consider valid, if the entered String is formed by letters or digits, haves one and only one @, and at most one dot('.') and must be after the @ symbol
      Parameters:
      email - String that represents the email to be checked
      min - The minimum length of the possible email.
      max - The minimum length of the possible email.
      Returns:
      True if the email complies with all the format constrains, false in any other case

    • checkPassword

      public static boolean checkPassword​(java.lang.String string, int min, int max)
      method of checking the validity of a possible password. For a password to be valid, it must be composed of numbers or letters, contain no spaces and be within the allowed character range.
      Parameters:
      string - The password to be checked.
      max - The maximum length of the string
      min - The minimum length of the string
      Returns:
      True if the entered String is valid, false otherwise.

    • checkStringLength

      public static boolean checkStringLength​(java.lang.String st, int min, int max)

    • checkDNI

      public static boolean checkDNI​(java.lang.String dni, int min, int max)
      Method for checking the validity of the DNI entered by the user. It is checked that it is not null, that the text entered has the appropriate length within the established range, and that the security character is correct.
      Parameters:
      dni - The input parameter must have the format xx.xxx.xxx-C, where 'x' must be a digit and C is the security character.
      min -
      max -
      Returns:
      true if the input parameter meets the requirements for length, format, and the security character is correct, and false otherwise.

    • checkPhoneNumber

      public static boolean checkPhoneNumber​(java.lang.String string, int min, int max)
      Method that seeks to check that the input parameter is within the established range and that it has a telephone number format. It is considered to have a phone number format if it is within the allowed range and begins with a digit or with a + symbol.
      Parameters:
      string - Input parameter to check if it is indeed a telephone number.
      min - Parameter where the minimum length that the telephone number to verify is established.
      max - Parameter where the maximum length that the telephone number to check must have is established.
      Returns:
      true if the input parameter to be checked is not null, it complies with the length range and it is verified that the first character of the parameter is a + sign or a digit. False in any other case.

    • checkInteger

      public static boolean checkInteger​(int integer, int min)
      Method used to check if a specific integer is greather or equal to an specific value.
      Parameters:
      integer - the Value to compare
      min - The minimun that the integer have to meet.
      Returns:
      true if is greater of equal to the minimun, false in eny other case.
